required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar (Gadovist) for Breast Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Multi-center, Phase 3 Study With Corresponding Blinded Image Reading to Determine the Efficacy and Safety of a Single Intravenous Injection of 0.1 mmol/kg Body Weight of Gadobutrol 1.0 Molar (Gadovist®) in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Breast Cancer Referred for Contrast-enhanced Breast MRI

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to look at the efficacy (how does it work) and safety of gadobutrol when used for obtaining MR images of both breasts.Women with a recent diagnosis of breast cancer by mammogram (X-ray examination of the breasts) may benefit from MRI of the breasts as MRI may detect additional breast cancers

primary_outcome.measure: Difference of Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
primary_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value. For ease of expression, the following abbreviations will be used: Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM), Unenhanced MRM (UMRM), combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM), X-ray mammography (XRM).

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
primary_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM for Non-malignant Breasts by Reader
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
primary_outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.

secondary_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM Based on Malignant Breasts
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: Index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participants eligible for the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Additional Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: Additional cancer was defined as cancer which was present according to SoT, but which was not defined as index cancer, i.e. was not known when the participant was enrolled into the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference of Confidence in Diagnosis for Breast Region Diagnosis Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM and CMRM+XRM vs XRM by Reader, Participant Level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
secondary_outcome.description: The investigator and the blinded readers each recorded his/her confidence in diagnosis for each breast region based on a 4-point scale (1 = not confident, 2 = somewhat confident, 3 = confident, and 4 = very confident). For each participant, the mean of the confidence responses for the diagnosed breast regions was calculated, and rounded to the nearest 0.5. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM Per Reader
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.

other_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity of in Non-malignant Breasts Using UMRM, XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM by Reader
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.

other_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity in Malignant Breasts Using UMRM, XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM by Reader
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).

other_outcome.measure: Breast Level Specificity for All Breasts by Imaging Modality and by Reader
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as FP when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as (N-FP)/N, where N was total number of breasts.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. Regions with malignant disease verified by SoT comprise unifocal and multifocal regions. Difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Unifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Unifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Multifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of Detection of Multicentric Malignant Disease Verified by SoT, Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Accuracy Difference of Presence of Bilateral Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Clinical Investigator, Participant Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: The disease state "bilateral malignant disease" was derived from the assessment of the different regions for each breast (right and left) for investigators for each imaging modality (UMRM, CMRM, XRM, UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM) based on the following rule: If the participant had at least one breast with no malignant region , the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as "No". If the participant had at least one malignant lesion in both breasts, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as "Yes". The proportion of correct matches of each different image set to the SoT for the existence of bilateral malignant disease were derived. The analysis was based on the difference in accuracy for the evaluation of bilateral malignant disease for the following image comparisons on a participant level. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Readers: Inter-reader Agreement on Sensitivity Based on Assessment for UMRM vs CMRM - Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Inter-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities (malignant disease / no malignant disease) for an assessment by the 2 image sets (UMRM and CMRM). Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Reader 1: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Reader 2: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Blinded Reader 3: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
other_outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).

other_outcome.measure: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection

other_outcome.measure: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by Histopathology by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection

other_outcome.measure: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow-up 24 Hours Post Injection - Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24 hours post injection
other_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured in a supine position. Blood pressure was not to be measured on the arm used for the injection.

other_outcome.measure: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow-up 24 Hours Post Injection - Heart Rate
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow-up visit (24 hours post injection)
other_outcome.description: Heart rate was measured in a supine position.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With at Least One Laboratory Parameter Change From Low or Normal at Baseline to Abnormally High at Follow-up 24 Hours Post Injection
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow-up visit (24 hours post injection)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with at least one occurrence of changing from low or normal at baseline to high at follow-up.

arm_group.description: Patients first received an unenhanced magnetic resonance mammography (MRM), followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection (i.v.) at a rate of 2 ml/sec. Unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective X-ray mammography (XRM) was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

intervention.description: A single bolus injection of gadobutrol 1.0 M; 0.1 mmol/kg body weight

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Recent histologically proven diagnosis of breast cancer after having obtained X-Ray Mammography (XRM) of both breasts (according to American College of Radiology [ACR] and performed no longer than 6 weeks prior to enrollment into the study) and has been referred for a contrast-enhanced Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM) prior to surgery of the breast.
- if female, a digital XRM is required if any of the following criteria is met:
- a. patient is younger than 50 years;
- b. patient has heterogeneously or extremely dense breasts;
- c. is not post-menopausal (post-menopause defined as at least 12 months prior to inclusion without menstruation).
- if female of childbearing potential, MRM should be performed on the 7-14th day of the menstrual cycle.
- has an estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) value >/= 60 mL/min/1.73m^2 derived from a serum creatinine result within 2 weeks prior to study enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
- is a female patient who is pregnant or lactating
- has any contraindication to the MRM examination (e.g. metal implants, phobia) or the use of gadolinium-containing contrast agents.
- has received any contrast agent within 24 hours prior to the study MRM, or is scheduled to receive any contrast agent within 24 hours after the study MRM.
- has severe cardiovascular disease (e.g., known long QT syndrome, acute myocardial infarction [< 14 days], unstable angina, congestive heart failure New York Heart Association class IV) or acute stroke (< 48 hours)).
- has acute renal insufficiency of any severity due to hepato-renal syndrome or in the peri-operative liver transplantation period or who has acute or chronic moderate or severe renal insufficiency (glomerular filtration rate < 60 mL/min/1.73m^2).
- has received chemotherapy or hormonal therapy for breast cancer within 6 months.
- has received hormone replacement therapy within 4 weeks prior to study drug administration.
- is scheduled or likely to require a surgery and/or biopsy in the time period up to 24 hours following study drug application
- has prior excisional biopsy or breast surgery less than 6 months before enrollment and between XRM and study MRM

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced magnetic resonance mammography (MRM), followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection (i.v.) at a rate of 2 ml/sec. Unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective X-ray mammography (XRM) was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Participants first received an unenhanced MRM, followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg bw [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an i.v. injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. UMRM and CMRM image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective XRM was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

outcome.title: Difference of Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value. For ease of expression, the following abbreviations will be used: Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM), Unenhanced MRM (UMRM), combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM), X-ray mammography (XRM).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SoT).

measure.title: Difference of Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value. For ease of expression, the following abbreviations will be used: Magnetic Resonance Mammography (MRM), Unenhanced MRM (UMRM), combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM), X-ray mammography (XRM).
measure.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SoT).

outcome.title: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SoT).

measure.title: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM Per Reader
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the clinical investigators and the 3 blinded readers using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants in the Full Analysis Set (FAS) who had regions with malignant disease verified by Standard of Truth (SoT).

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM for Non-malignant Breasts by Reader
outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 367 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts without malignant disease as verified by Standard of Truth (SoT) for which a CMRM assessment was available.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM for Non-malignant Breasts by Reader
measure.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 367 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts without malignant disease as verified by Standard of Truth (SoT) for which a CMRM assessment was available.

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM Based on Malignant Breasts
outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts with malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment by the imaging modality was available.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity of CMRM Based on Malignant Breasts
measure.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).
measure.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts with malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment by the imaging modality was available.

outcome.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
outcome.description: Index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participants eligible for the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in FAS; index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participant eligible for the study.

measure.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
measure.description: Index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participants eligible for the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 388 participants in FAS; index cancer was defined as the cancer confirmed by histology prior to inclusion which made the participant eligible for the study.

outcome.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Additional Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
outcome.description: Additional cancer was defined as cancer which was present according to SoT, but which was not defined as index cancer, i.e. was not known when the participant was enrolled into the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The evaluation was based on the 84 participants in the FAS who had at least one additional cancer region according to SoT.

measure.title: Percentage Difference of Participants Whose Additional Index Cancers Were Detected Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM vs XRM, and CMRM vs CMRM+XRM
measure.description: Additional cancer was defined as cancer which was present according to SoT, but which was not defined as index cancer, i.e. was not known when the participant was enrolled into the study. The difference in percentage of participants was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM value minus XRM value, CMRM value minus CMRM+XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The evaluation was based on the 84 participants in the FAS who had at least one additional cancer region according to SoT.

outcome.title: Difference of Confidence in Diagnosis for Breast Region Diagnosis Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM and CMRM+XRM vs XRM by Reader, Participant Level
outcome.description: The investigator and the blinded readers each recorded his/her confidence in diagnosis for each breast region based on a 4-point scale (1 = not confident, 2 = somewhat confident, 3 = confident, and 4 = very confident). For each participant, the mean of the confidence responses for the diagnosed breast regions was calculated, and rounded to the nearest 0.5. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

measure.title: Difference of Confidence in Diagnosis for Breast Region Diagnosis Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM and CMRM+XRM vs XRM by Reader, Participant Level
measure.description: The investigator and the blinded readers each recorded his/her confidence in diagnosis for each breast region based on a 4-point scale (1 = not confident, 2 = somewhat confident, 3 = confident, and 4 = very confident). For each participant, the mean of the confidence responses for the diagnosed breast regions was calculated, and rounded to the nearest 0.5. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure
measure.units: difference of scores on a scale

outcome.title: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM Per Reader
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 390 participants who had regions with malignant disease verified by SoT with available assessment by the imaging modality.

measure.title: Sensitivity for Detection of Full Extent of Malignant Breast Disease Using XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM Per Reader
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the sensitivity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants.
measure.population: The analyses were performed for a total number of 390 participants who had regions with malignant disease verified by SoT with available assessment by the imaging modality.

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity of in Non-malignant Breasts Using UMRM, XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM by Reader
outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 367 participants; evaluable for specificity were breasts with no malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment of the imaging modality was available.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity of in Non-malignant Breasts Using UMRM, XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM by Reader
measure.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as false positive (FP), when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. When all breast regions were assessed as non-malignant, the breast was defined as true negative (TN). Breast level specificity was first defined in participant as number of TN-breasts in participant divided by number of non-malignant breasts in participant. Subsequently the specificity percentage was calculated based on the mean of the specificities across all participants who contributed with at least one non-malignant breast.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 367 participants; evaluable for specificity were breasts with no malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment of the imaging modality was available.

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity in Malignant Breasts Using UMRM, XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM by Reader
outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants; evaluable for specificity were breasts with malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment by the imaging modality was available.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity in Malignant Breasts Using UMRM, XRM, CMRM+XRM and UMRM+XRM by Reader
measure.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP).
measure.population: The analyses were based on 390 participants; evaluable for specificity were breasts with malignant disease verified by SoT for which an assessment by the imaging modality was available.

outcome.title: Breast Level Specificity for All Breasts by Imaging Modality and by Reader
outcome.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as FP when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as (N-FP)/N, where N was total number of breasts.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 395 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts with or without malignant disease verified by SoT with available assessments by the imaging modality.

measure.title: Breast Level Specificity for All Breasts by Imaging Modality and by Reader
measure.description: A non-malignant breast was defined as FP when the reader assessed at least one breast region as malignant. A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as (N-FP)/N, where N was total number of breasts.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 395 participants in FAS; evaluable for specificity were breasts with or without malignant disease verified by SoT with available assessments by the imaging modality.

outcome.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. Regions with malignant disease verified by SoT comprise unifocal and multifocal regions. Difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

measure.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. Regions with malignant disease verified by SoT comprise unifocal and multifocal regions. Difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

outcome.title: Sensitivity Difference in the Determination of Unifocal Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. The difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference in sensitivity is calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

outcome.title: Specificity Difference in the Determination of Malignant Breast Disease Using CMRM vs UMRM, CMRM+XRM vs UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM vs XRM Verified by SoT, Breast Region Level
outcome.description: A malignant breast was defined as FP, when the reader using the respective imaging modality assessed more breast regions as malignant as were present according to SoT. Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.

Otherwise the breast was assessed as TN. Specificity was then defined as TN/(TN+FP). The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

outcome.title: Sensitivity of Detection of Multicentric Malignant Disease Verified by SoT, Breast Level
outcome.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

measure.title: Sensitivity of Detection of Multicentric Malignant Disease Verified by SoT, Breast Level
measure.description: For a single participant the sensitivity was defined as the proportion of malignant breast regions that were recognized by the reader using the respective imaging modality as malignant. Subsequently the point estimates were calculated based on the mean of the sensitivities across all participants. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

outcome.title: Accuracy Difference of Presence of Bilateral Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Clinical Investigator, Participant Level
outcome.description: The disease state “bilateral malignant disease” was derived from the assessment of the different regions for each breast (right and left) for investigators for each imaging modality (UMRM, CMRM, XRM, UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM) based on the following rule: If the participant had at least one breast with no malignant region , the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “No”. If the participant had at least one malignant lesion in both breasts, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “Yes”. The proportion of correct matches of each different image set to the SoT for the existence of bilateral malignant disease were derived. The analysis was based on the difference in accuracy for the evaluation of bilateral malignant disease for the following image comparisons on a participant level. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The analyses were based on 380 participants in FAS; evaluable subjects with at least one region verified by SoT in each breast with available CMRM, UMRM, CMRM+XRM, UMRM+XRM and XRM assessment.

measure.title: Accuracy Difference of Presence of Bilateral Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Clinical Investigator, Participant Level
measure.description: The disease state “bilateral malignant disease” was derived from the assessment of the different regions for each breast (right and left) for investigators for each imaging modality (UMRM, CMRM, XRM, UMRM+XRM, and CMRM+XRM) based on the following rule: If the participant had at least one breast with no malignant region , the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “No”. If the participant had at least one malignant lesion in both breasts, the assessment of bilateral malignant disease was categorized as “Yes”. The proportion of correct matches of each different image set to the SoT for the existence of bilateral malignant disease were derived. The analysis was based on the difference in accuracy for the evaluation of bilateral malignant disease for the following image comparisons on a participant level. The difference was calculated as CMRM value minus UMRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus UMRM+XRM value, CMRM+XRM value minus XRM value respectively.
measure.population: The analyses were based on 380 participants in FAS; evaluable subjects with at least one region verified by SoT in each breast with available CMRM, UMRM, CMRM+XRM, UMRM+XRM and XRM assessment.

outcome.title: Blinded Readers: Inter-reader Agreement on Sensitivity Based on Assessment for UMRM vs CMRM - Breast Region Level
outcome.description: Inter-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities (malignant disease / no malignant disease) for an assessment by the 2 image sets (UMRM and CMRM). Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

measure.title: Blinded Readers: Inter-reader Agreement on Sensitivity Based on Assessment for UMRM vs CMRM - Breast Region Level
measure.description: Inter-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities (malignant disease / no malignant disease) for an assessment by the 2 image sets (UMRM and CMRM). Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure

outcome.title: Blinded Reader 1: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

measure.title: Blinded Reader 1: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
measure.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). For each of the 3 readers, intra-reader agreement was assessed by considering each breast region to have 2 possibilities for an assessment by CMRM: matched SoT or did not match SoT. Kappa value varies from 0 (no agreement) to 1 (perfect agreement).
measure.population: All participants in the FAS with assessments for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Blinded Reader 2: Intra-reader Variability Based on Assessment for CMRM - Breast Level
outcome.description: Intra-reader variability was assessed using a kappa on the match to SoT for the different regions within each participant (match, no match SoT). outcome.title: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
outcome.time_frame: Immediately before injection and after injection
outcome.population: The Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) amendment re-defined study objectives and replaced protocol-defined parameters such as categorical accuracy prior to database closure and breaking the blind. The SAP amendment is based upon review of results of an identical clinical study within the "GEMMA" program and also includes advice from the FDA.

measure.title: Categorical Accuracy Difference of Extent of Malignant Disease Verified by SoT by Majority Reader, Breast Region Level
measure.population: The Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) amendment re-defined study objectives and replaced protocol-defined parameters such as categorical accuracy prior to database closure and breaking the blind. outcome.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured in a supine position. Blood pressure was not to be measured on the arm used for the injection.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 24 hours post injection
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)
group.description: Patients first received an unenhanced magnetic resonance mammography (MRM), followed by a gadobutrol-enhanced MRM. Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. Unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective X-ray mammography (XRM) was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

measure.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
measure.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure were measured in a supine position. Blood pressure was not to be measured on the arm used for the injection.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

outcome.title: Vital Signs Change From Baseline and Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection - Heart Rate
outcome.description: Heart rate was measured in a supine position.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow–up visit (24 hours post injection)
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

Unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. After the evaluation of the UMRM or CMRM the respective X-ray mammography (XRM) was added and evaluated together with the UMRM images.

measure.description: Heart rate was measured in a supine position.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With at Least One Laboratory Parameter Change From Low or Normal at Baseline to Abnormally High at Follow–up 24 Hours Post Injection
outcome.description: Number of participants with at least one occurrence of changing from low or normal at baseline to high at follow-up.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Follow–up visit (24 hours post injection)
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAF): The analysis of safety data was performed using all available data from all participants who administered any amount of gadobutrol.

reported_events.time_frame: Between start of contrast injection and up to 24 hours post-contrast

group.title: Gadobutrol (Gadavist, BAY86-4875)

Gadobutrol was administered at the standard dose of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight (bw) [0.1 ml/kg bw] as an intravenous injection at a rate of 2 ml/sec. unenhanced MRM (UMRM) and combined unenhanced and contrast (gadobutrol)-enhanced MRM (CMRM) image sets were evaluated in a randomized fashion. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
